thread.title: Merkel, Xi agree to work on steel overcapacity within G20

title: Merkel, Xi agree to work on steel overcapacity within G20
text: March 17, 2018 / 3:32 PM / Updated 27 minutes ago Merkel, Xi agree to work on steel overcapacity within G20 Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BERLIN (Reuters) - German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Saturday discussed overcapacity in world steel markets and agreed to work on solutions within the framework of the G20 group of industrialised nations, Merkelâ€™s spokesman said. Workers are seen at a steel mill of Dongbei Special Steel in Dalian, Liaoning province, China March 13, 2018. Picture taken March 13, 2018. REUTERS/Stringer The two leaders emphasised close ties between the two countries, which are both facing planned U.S. steel and aluminium tariffs, and agreed to deepen the strategic partnership between them, Steffen Seibert said in a statement. He said Merkel invited the Chinese government to visit Berlin for consultations, and Xi invited Merkel to visit China. They also discussed the current situation in North Korea regarding its nuclear and missile development efforts. Reporting by Andrea Shalal; Editing by Richard Balmforth
